keyMoments.title: Hancock's Proper Introduction
keyMoments.description: Boa Hancock is properly introduced as the Pirate Empress, one of the Seven Warlords of the Sea, and captain of the Kuja Pirates. She meets with Vice-Admiral Momonga.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes Hancock as a major character and Warlord, setting up her crucial role in the Summit War saga.

keyMoments.title: Refuses Marine Summons
keyMoments.description: Hancock boldly refuses Momonga's summons to join the war against Whitebeard, showing no fear of losing her Warlord status.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes her defiant and prideful personality, demonstrating her independence from World Government authority.
keyMoments.quote: Do as you please. I refuse.

keyMoments.title: First Use of Mero Mero Mellow
keyMoments.description: Hancock demonstrates her Mero Mero no Mi Devil Fruit power, using her signature technique to petrify Momonga's entire crew.
keyMoments.significance: First demonstration of her devastating Devil Fruit ability, establishing her as an incredibly powerful Warlord.

bounties.reason: Bounty frozen upon joining the Seven Warlords of the Sea

abilities.description: Hancock forms a heart shape with her hands and fires heart-shaped beams that petrify anyone attracted to her.

relationships.description: Hancock defies Momonga's orders and uses her powers against his crew, showing contempt for Marine authority.

evolutionMoments.description: Momonga attempts to summon Hancock to war; she refuses and petrifies his crew.

relationships.description: Sandersonia is Hancock's younger sister and accompanies her to meet Momonga.

evolutionMoments.description: Sandersonia stands by Hancock's side during the confrontation with Momonga.

relationships.description: Marigold is Hancock's younger sister and accompanies her to meet Momonga.

evolutionMoments.description: Marigold stands by Hancock's side during the confrontation with Momonga.

reveals.information: Pirate Empress and Snake Princess of Amazon Lily
One of the Seven Warlords of the Sea
User of the Mero Mero no Mi Devil Fruit
Prideful, defiant of authority, and uses her beauty as a weapon

keyMoments.title: Announces Ace's Execution
keyMoments.description: Momonga informs Hancock that Portgas D. Ace's execution has been scheduled and that Whitebeard is likely to intervene.
keyMoments.significance: Delivers the critical news that sets up the Summit War saga's central conflict.
keyMoments.quote: Portgas D. Ace will be executed, and we expect Whitebeard to make his move.

keyMoments.title: Resists Hancock's Powers Through Pain
keyMoments.description: Momonga stabs his own hand with a knife, using pain to overcome his attraction to Hancock and resist her Mero Mero Mellow ability.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates exceptional willpower and reveals a weakness in Hancock's Devil Fruit power.
keyMoments.quote: One... is not the same as 'none'!

abilities.description: Momonga uses self-inflicted pain to maintain his willpower and resist Devil Fruit abilities that affect the mind.

relationships.description: Momonga attempts to enforce the World Government's summons on Hancock, who defies him and attacks his crew.

evolutionMoments.description: Momonga delivers the summons to Hancock; she refuses and petrifies his crew.

reveals.information: Dedicated, resilient, and willing to injure himself to complete his mission

keyMoments.title: Attacks Luffy
keyMoments.description: Marguerite realizes she cannot afford to maintain her friendship with Luffy and attacks him with haki-infused arrows, forcing him to flee.
keyMoments.significance: Shows the internal conflict between friendship and duty, and the consequences of Amazon Lily's strict laws.
keyMoments.quote: I cannot be friendly with you anymore!

abilities.description: Marguerite can infuse her arrows with haki, making them more powerful and able to harm Devil Fruit users.

relationships.description: Marguerite has been friendly with Luffy but must attack him due to Amazon Lily's laws, creating internal conflict.

evolutionMoments.description: Marguerite chooses duty over friendship and attacks Luffy with haki-infused arrows.

reveals.information: Can use haki to infuse arrows with power
Torn between personal feelings and duty to her island's customs

name.japanese: ボア・サンダーソニア

keyMoments.title: First Appearance with Hancock
keyMoments.description: Sandersonia appears alongside her sister Hancock during the confrontation with Vice-Admiral Momonga.
keyMoments.significance: Introduces one of Hancock's sisters, establishing the family dynamic.

relationships.description: Sandersonia is Hancock's younger sister and loyal supporter.

evolutionMoments.description: Sandersonia accompanies Hancock to meet Momonga, showing sisterly loyalty.

reveals.information: Sister of Boa Hancock and Boa Marigold

name.japanese: ボア・マリーゴールド

keyMoments.title: First Appearance with Hancock
keyMoments.description: Marigold appears alongside her sister Hancock during the confrontation with Vice-Admiral Momonga.
keyMoments.significance: Introduces one of Hancock's sisters, establishing the family dynamic.

relationships.description: Marigold is Hancock's younger sister and loyal supporter.

evolutionMoments.description: Marigold accompanies Hancock to meet Momonga, showing sisterly loyalty.

reveals.information: Sister of Boa Hancock and Boa Sandersonia

keyMoments.title: Decides to Leave Amazon Lily
keyMoments.description: Luffy expresses his determination to leave Amazon Lily and reunite with his crew, refusing to stay despite the dangers.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Luffy's unwavering commitment to his crew and responsibility as captain.
keyMoments.quote: I have to get back to my crew and defeat those enemies!

bounties.reason: Post-Enies Lobby and Sabaody Archipelago incidents

relationships.description: Marguerite has been helping Luffy but must now attack him due to Amazon Lily's laws.

evolutionMoments.description: Marguerite attacks Luffy despite their friendship, creating tension.

reveals.information: Desperate to reunite with his crew after being separated at Sabaody
